      • showBestPrices

        public static int showBestPrices(java.lang.String[] materialsName,
                                 int[] materialsPriceHC,
                                 int[] materialsPriceFC,
                                 int[] materialsPriceFB,
                                 int[] materialsQuantity,
                                 int materialsAmount,
                                 java.lang.String location)
        Shows the cheapest price for each material and calculates the total based on them
        Pre: The list of names, prices and quantities already have values. Same with materialsAmount and location
        Post: The cheapest price for each material and the total based on them
        Parameters:
        materialsName - Array used to print the name of each material materialsName != null
        materialsPriceHC - Array used to calculate the cheapest price materialsPriceHC != null
        materialsPriceFC - Array used to calculate the cheapest price materialsPriceFC != null
        materialsPriceFB - Array used to calculate the cheapest price materialsPriceFB != null
        materialsQuantity - The list with the required quantity of each material materialsQuantity != null
        materialsAmount - The number of elements needed
        location - Location of the user location.equalsIgnoreCase("Norte" || "Centro" || "Sur")
        Returns:
        result The total based on the cheapest prices. Returns an integer

        Pre: The list of names and types already have values. Same with materialsAmount.

        Parameters:
        materialsName - Array used in the materialsType method != null
        materialsType - Array used to get the material's type materialsName != null
        type - Value used in the materialsType method type.equalsIgnoreCase("Obra blanca" || "Obra negra" || "Pintura")
        materialsAmount - The number of elements needed
